Disability bias.Bias Definition: Bias related to disability occurs when individuals are unfairly treated, stereotyped, or discriminated against based on physical, cognitive, or mental disabilities.
Disability bias.Bias Description:
Stereotyping: Assigning characteristics or limitations based on disability status
Example: 'People with disabilities can't hold leadership positions.'
Example: 'Wheelchair users are always dependent on others.'
Exclusion / underrepresentation: Omitting people with disabilities in examples or assuming they cannot perform certain tasks.
Unequal evaluation: Making assumptions about capabilities based solely on disability status.

Physical appearance bias.Bias Definition: Bias related to physical appearance occurs when individuals are judged, stereotyped, or treated differently based on their physical characteristics, body type, or attractiveness.
Physical appearance bias.Bias Description:
Stereotyping: Assigning personality traits, competence, or character based on physical appearance
Example: 'Overweight people are lazy and undisciplined.'
Example: 'Attractive people are more competent professionals.'
Discrimination: Making assumptions about someone's abilities, worth, or character based on how they look.
Unfair treatment: Providing different opportunities or evaluations based on physical appearance rather than actual qualifications.

SES bias.Bias Definition: Bias related to socioeconomic status (SES) occurs when individuals are unfairly judged, stereotyped, or treated differently based on their economic background, wealth, income, or social class.
SES bias.Bias Description:
Stereotyping: Making assumptions about character, intelligence, or work ethic based on economic status
Example: 'Poor people are unmotivated and don't value education.'
Example: 'Wealthy people are all arrogant and out of touch.'
Class discrimination: Denying opportunities or respect based on perceived economic background.
Generalizations: Assuming behaviors, values, or capabilities based solely on socioeconomic indicators.

Sexual orientation bias.Bias Definition: Bias related to sexual orientation occurs when individuals are unfairly treated, stereotyped, or discriminated against based on their sexual orientation (e.g., heterosexual, homosexual, bisexual).
Sexual orientation bias.Bias Description:
Stereotyping: Assigning characteristics or behaviors based on sexual orientation
Example: 'Gay men are all feminine and work in creative fields.'
Example: 'Bisexual people can't commit to relationships.'
Exclusion / erasure: Ignoring or invalidating non-heterosexual orientations.
Discrimination: Treating people differently in professional, social, or personal contexts based on sexual orientation.
